creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: group of men having a discussion behind an easel at center; to the R, a man addresses a seated woman holding a fan, while another woman looks down at the table next to her; a few other people, paintings, and art supplies in background
inscription:
Signature, Mark

-- on recto in brown at bottom center, below platemark: [illegible initials and 1832]
-- in graphite on mount: L88.79.5
-- on verso in ink at lower right: [Gravelot in [??]
-- on verso: illegible letters and 1832
markings: initials on recto below platemark and on verso toward bottom center
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
signed: signed in plate, lower left: [Gravelot in. et fec.]
title: A Painter's Studio
